Beto Berharap Pengurus Baru PSSI Bisa Rapikan Jadwal Liga 1
07 Nov 2019, 13:38 by Antara, Nurdin Saleh
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Pemain klub Madura United dan Timnas Indonesia, Alberto "Beto" Goncalves, berharap pengurus baru PSSI periode 2019-2023 mampu merapikan jadwal Liga 1.
“Menurut saya, soal jadwal itu paling penting,” ujar Beto, Kamis.
Menurut pesepak bola berdarah Brasil itu, jadwal Liga 1 saat ini sering kali tidak ideal karena kerap kali jarak antarpertandingan sangat dekat.
Hal tersebut dinilainya dapat merugikan para pemain. Mereka berpotensi cedera karena kelelahan, apalagi jika sang pemain dipanggil juga ke tim nasional.
Kondisi itu juga dialami oleh Beto yang kini dalam pemulihan cedera. Setelah bertanding melawan Persib Bandung pada Sabtu (5 Oktober), lima hari kemudian dia berada di Dubai untuk memperkuat timnas menghadapi Uni Emirat Arab (UAE) dalam laga Kualifikasi Piala Dunia 2022.
Selanjutnya, Beto kembali ke Indonesia dan langsung ke Bali untuk menghadapi Vietnam, juga Kualifikasi Piala Dunia 2022, pada Selasa (15 Oktober).
Lalu dia bertandang ke Padang pada Minggu (20 Oktober)) menghadapi Semen Padang dan empat hari kemudian terbang lagi ke Makassar untuk melawan PSM. Di pertandingan ini, baru bermain 20 menit berlaga, Beto mengalami cedera otot paha belakang (hamstring) yang membuatnya harus melakukan pemulihan sekitar satu minggu dan dia pun tertunda bergabung dengan tim nasional U-22 untuk SEA Games 2019.
“Saya cedera karena kelelahan. Kalau jadwal tidak bagus, bisa banyak pemain yang cedera,” tutur Beto yang sudah membuat 14 gol dari 16 penampilannya bersama timnas U-23 serta senior Indonesia.
Bukan hanya itu, Beto juga menganggap bahwa padatnya jadwal liga membuat para pemain timnas kerap mengalami keletihan ketika berlaga di Grup G Kualifikasi Piala Dunia 2022 zona Asia terutama di babak kedua. Indonesia sendiri belum pernah menang di empat laga Kualifikasi Piala Dunia 2022 yang membuat skuat ‘Garuda’ berada di posisi juru kunci klasemen.
“Saya berharap pengurus PSSI bisa melakukan yang terbaik demi kemajuan sepak bola,” tutur pemain naturalisasi berusia 38 tahun tersebut.
PSSI menuntaskan pemilihan Komite Eksekutif (Exco) periode 2019-2023 dalam kongres luar biasa (KLB) di Hotel Shangri-La, Jakarta, Sabtu (2 November).
Posisi ketua umum baru PSSI diisi Komisaris Jenderal Polisi Mochamad Iriawan. Sebagai wakil ketua umum, ada Mayor Jenderal TNI Cucu Somantri dan pelaksana tugas ketua umum PSSI dalam beberapa bulan terakhir, Iwan Budianto.
Terakhir, sebanyak 12 nama terpilih menjadi anggota exco PSSI yaitu Yoyok Sukawi, Dirk Soplanit, Endri Erawan, Haruna Soemitro, Hasnuryadi Sulaiman, Juni Rahman, Pieter Tanuri, Sonhadji, Ahmad Riyadh, Yunus Nusi, Hasani Abdul Gani dan Vivin Cahyani Sungkono.

Beto Hopes PSSI New Management Can Tidy Up League Schedule 1
Nov. 7, 2019, 13:38 by Antara, Nurdin Saleh
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Madura United club player and Indonesian national team, Alberto "Beto" Goncalves, hope that the new PSSI management for 2019-2023 will be able to tidy up the League 1 schedule.
"In my opinion, the matter of schedule is the most important," Beto said, Thursday.
According to the Brazilian bloody footballer, the current League 1 schedule is often not ideal because often the distance between matches is very close.
This is considered to be detrimental to the players. They have the potential to get injured due to fatigue, especially if the player is also called to the national team.
The condition is also experienced by Beto who is now in injury recovery. After competing against Persib Bandung on Saturday (5 October), five days later he was in Dubai to strengthen the national team to face the United Arab Emirates (UAE) in the 2022 World Cup Qualifiers.
Furthermore, Beto returned to Indonesia and went directly to Bali to face Vietnam, as well as the 2022 World Cup Qualifiers, on Tuesday (15 October).
Then he traveled to Padang on Sunday (October 20) to face Semen Padang and four days later flew again to Makassar to fight PSM. In this match, just playing 20 minutes competing, Beto suffered a hamstring injury which made him have to make recovery about one week and he was delayed to join the U-22 national team for the 2019 SEA Games.
"I was injured because of fatigue. If the schedule is not good, there could be a lot of injured players, "said Beto, who has made 14 goals in 16 appearances for the U-23 national team and senior Indonesian.
Not only that, Beto also considers that the tight schedule of the league makes the national team players often experience fatigue when competing in Group G World Cup Qualification 2022 Asia zone, especially in the second round. Indonesia itself has never won in four matches in the 2022 World Cup Qualifiers that make the squad 'Garuda' in the position of caretaker standings.
"I hope that the management of PSSI can do their best for the progress of football," said the 38-year-old naturalized player.
PSSI completed the selection of the Executive Committee (Exco) for the 2019-2023 period in an extraordinary congress (KLB) at the Shangri-La Hotel, Jakarta, Saturday (November 2).
The position of the new chairman of PSSI was filled by Police Commissioner General Mochamad Iriawan. As deputy chairperson, there was Major General of the Indonesian Armed Forces Cucu Somantri and acting as PSSI's general chair in recent months, Iwan Budianto.
Finally, as many as 12 names were selected to become PSSI exco members namely Yoyok Sukawi, Dirk Soplanit, Endri Erawan, Haruna Soemitro, Hasnuryadi Sulaiman, Juni Rahman, Pieter Tanuri, Sonhadji, Ahmad Riyadh, Yunus Nusi, Hasani Abdul Gani and Vivin Cahyani Sungkono.
